name: wl-dfrexfi
params: setvar s0, class c0, wff w0
body: |- wb(wl-rex(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wb(wl-rex(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0))), wnfc(s0, c0))

body.origin:
|- wb(wl-rex(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)))
-| wnfc(s0, c0)
-| wi(wnfc(s0, c0), wb(wl-rex(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0))))

cumulated.origin:

body.origin: |- wi(wnfc(s0, c0), wb(wl-rex(s0, c0, w0), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0))))

comment: Restricted universal quantification ( ~ df-wl-rex ) allows a simplification, if we can assume all occurrences of ` x ` in ` A ` are bounded. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 26-May-2023.)
